title: How much will a Tesla cost in 2020? - Quora

response.answer_text: Zero. Tesla doesn’t pay dividends to shareholders, and they are unlikely to do so for the near future. They are not really profitable, so their aren’t any profits to distribute. And, any extra cash they do have is likely to be put right back into the business. It is a highly capital-intensive business that needs constant money to produce new vehicles, build new factories, and invest in R&D. They type of people who invest in Tesla are looking for growth in the stock value, not dividends.

Currently - 6th January 2020, $443 Nasdaq, about $80 billion. That’s after the Q4 delivery figures and before the Q4 statement in late January. Expect it to go up and down but 2020 will be a good year for Tesla.
